title: How to Make Tarragon Vinegar

steps.headline: Bruise the tarragon leaves lightly to release the flavour.
Pack the leaves into a container.
Pour the vinegar over the leaves in the container.
Cover the container and leave for 2—3 weeks.
steps.description: This will draw out the flavour of the tarragon into the vinegar.

steps.headline: Pour the strained vinegar into bottles.
steps.description: Add the sprig of tarragon (one for each bottle) before pouring in the vinegar.

tyn: Large jar or ceramic pot for marinating
text: Bruise the tarragon leaves lightly to release the flavour.  Pack the leaves into a container.  Pour the vinegar over the leaves in the container.  Cover the container and leave for 2—3 weeks. This will draw out the flavour of the tarragon into the vinegar. Pour the strained vinegar into bottles. Add the sprig of tarragon (one for each bottle) before pouring in the vinegar. Screw on the lid. Label and date. Finished.
